alert.note: Alert for Emery (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 2:25PM MDT until August 20 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Emery County in central Utah... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the Trail Mountain burn scar. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen, and additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the Trail Mountain burn scar will result in debris flow moving through Huntington Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Huntington Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
